ref: 7395 nírvartatē ʻ comes forth, develops ʼ ŚBr., ʻ is accom- plished, is finished ʼ Mn. 2. nirvr̥tta -- ʻ accomplished, produced, ended ʼ Mn. 3. nírvartayati ʻ creates, finishes ʼ RV. [√vr̥t]
Pa. nibbattati ʻ comes out of, is produced ʼ;
Ku. nimaṭṇo ʻ to end, perish, disappear ʼ;
H. nibaṭnā ʻ to be settled ʼ (< *nibāṭ -- whence new tr. nibāṛnā and further intr. nibaṛnā unless < nirvr̥ta -- ; nipaṭnā from caus. nipṭānā < nibṭānā);
M. nivaṭṇẽ ʻ to come out clear ʼ. <->
Si. navatinavā intr. ʻ to stop ʼ (GS 22) rather < nívartate.
